you about a few of those,

1336.20.text:
but I also want
to talk about how

1339.84.text:
Now I don't blame people
for feeling somewhat

1343.75.text:
negative toward the art
of magic in general.

1345.93.text:
Because often, it seems like
a lot of magical presentations

1348.76.text:
that people see do
one of two things.

1352.71.text:
they insult you and
your intelligence

1354.98.text:
by pretending that you
don't know that there's

1358.30.text:
a string floating the
dollar, or the magician

1363.91.text:
gives you the impression
that he expects

1366.04.text:
you to believe that
he actually holds

1367.58.text:
the powers that his

1370.30.text:
This kind of insults

1372.79.text:
like you know that
he's not a wizard.

1379.33.text:
Either that, or
magic is presented

1380.95.text:
as a puzzle that pits the
audience against the magician

1383.58.text:
in some sort of
twisted battle of wits

1385.16.text:
where if the magician

1389.79.text:
If he doesn't, then the

1395.41.text:
Now that being said,
I do believe strongly

1397.19.text:
that magic has the
potential to be

1399.87.text:
a very intellectual
and serious art form.

1404.06.text:
And that's because
what magic ultimately

1405.73.text:
deals with is something
very, very powerful, and that

1408.90.text:
is the nature of
truth-- what is reality.

1414.56.text:
At any moment, at
any given time,

1417.08.text:
the most important
basic belief you form

1420.53.text:
is what is real--
what is my reality.

1424.15.text:
And it's from this belief
that we form all of our others

1426.48.text:
and if we make errors in
this judgment, obviously

1430.91.text:
When I'm walking into
Google across the street,

1434.77.text:
if I make an error in

1436.60.text:
and I don't see the car

1440.97.text:

1444.02.text:
mental ways, psychological

1448.19.text:
This "what is real"
is one of our most

1453.05.text:
And it's always
humming along right

1454.63.text:
under our level of
conscious awareness.

1456.84.text:
And I think it can be with
magic, a very profound thing.

The key to creating
magical experiences

1465.09.text:
is not to convince your audience
that they may or may not

1469.43.text:
The key to creating magical

in a way that brings people

1490.33.text:
question just what
is possible to have

1494.69.text:
Now as much as we all

1498.78.text:
as logical and rational

1502.09.text:
have to look so far as our

1506.48.text:
when in anger or in love or

1510.40.text:
how wrong of an
assumption this is.

1513.57.text:
No matter how much we like
to praise our rational side,

1517.94.text:
there's no arguing that we
are ruled by our emotions.

1521.61.text: We are ruled by our emotions.

1523.19.text:
And it's important to--
well, and sometimes this

1526.03.text:
can be a very bad thing,
because sometimes we

1528.58.text:
find ourselves acting in ways
that we don't want to act,

1531.90.text:
or not being able to do the

1556.73.text:
it's vital to know

it's like, very few

1625.70.text:
